title: Trilogy of Terror
review: This kind of storytelling is a long way from the elevated horror we enjoy these days. It makes me glad we now live in an era of high-budget TV dramas that can look almost as good as movies. This has real old fashioned television acting, blocking for 4:3 screens, and horrid sound quality. The first two segments are far from terrifying, more like dramas with macarbre twists at the end. All three featured dun dun daaah musical stings at the key moments too, which left me re-evaluating my Halloween viewing decisions.
